title: WCAS HISTORY 286-0-20 World War II in Asia

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: WWII transformed Asia, leading to defeat for Japan, Communist revolution in China, and the decolonization of the rest of Asia. The conflict wrought unprecedented destruction: entire cities were leveled, whole populations decimated. But civilians were not only victims; they were also participants in a "total war" for which governments mobilized societies and organized economies to a degree never before seen. This course will concentrate on the dilemmas that faced the war leaders and their followers, occupiers and the occupied alike.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
AREA OF CONCENTRATION: Asia/Middle East
GRADING BASIS: Student option (P/N allowed)

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: TEACHING METHOD: Lecture and Discussion Sections

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: EVALUATION METHOD: Evaluation is on the basis of two written assignments (30% each), a take-home final exam (25%), and informed participation in discussion, including short quizzes when needed (15%). One of the two writing assignments focus on assessing unintended but historically important consequences of major decisions/acts in the course materials. Students should expect to do a compensatory written assignment for any missed discussion sections.
